title.narrative: GIZ: Stöd till syriska oppositionens deltagande i FN-ledda intra-syriska samtal
GIZ: Support to Syrian opposition for participating in UN-led intra-syrian talks

description.narrative: Insatsen syftar till att upprätthålla ett sekretariat för delegaterna från den syriska oppositionsgruppen som deltar i förhandlingarna. Sekretariatet ska tillhandahålla delegationsmedlemmarna logistiskt stöd (inklusive resor och logi i samband med förhandlingarna) samt skapa en "säker plats" där gruppen kan förbereda, genomföra och följa upp förhandlingarna. Dessutom kommer det finnas faciliteter för ett pressrådgivande team och bilaterala informationsmöten.

Insatsen syftar till att under sex månader upprätthålla ett sekretariat för delegaterna från den syriska oppositionsgruppen som deltar i de FN-ledda förhandlingarna för Syrien. Sekretariatet ska tillhandahålla delegationsmedlemmarna logistiskt stöd (inklusive resor och logi i samband med förhandlingarna) samt skapa en "säker plats" där gruppen kan förbereda, genomföra och följa upp förhandlingarna. Dessutom kommer det finnas faciliteter för ett pressrådgivande team och bilaterala informationsmöten. Den 18 december 2015 antog FN: s säkerhetsråd resolution 2254 som lägger fram en 18-månaders färdplan för fred i Syrien, som kräver vapenvila, en överenskommelse om en ny konstitution och demokratiska val som hålls i slutet av perioden. Inom dessa samtal representeras den syriska oppositionen av en kärngrupp bestående av 20 medlemmar plus stödjande representanter (ca 30 personer) och supportpersonal (15 personer max).

The purpose of the contribution is to, throughout a period of six months, run a secretariat for delegates from the Syrian opposition group participating in the UN-led negotiations for Syria. The secretariat will provide logistical support to delegation members (including travel and lodging in connection with the negotiations) and create a "safe space" in which the group can prepare, implement and follow up the negotiations.

participating-org.narrative: GIZ/Deutsche Gesellschaft fur Internationale Zusammenarbeit GmbH
GIZ/Deutsche Gesellschaft fur Internationale Zusammenarbeit GmbH

sector.narrative: Civilian peace-building, conflict prevention and resolution

tag.narrative: 16.8 - Broaden and strengthen the participation of developing countries in the institutions of global governance.
16.8 - Utvidga och stärka utvecklingsländernas deltagande i institutionerna för global styrning.

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: During the period covered by the report the UN Office of the Special Envoy (OSE) headed by Staffan de Mistura (until end of 2018) and Geir Pedersen (as of January 2019) has not invited opposition representatives -The Syrian Negotiation Commission (SNC) to official intra-Syrian negotiations to Geneva. Therefore, the project was not able to implement the organizational and logistical support to the delegates of the SNC. There are no results reported. The current project finished in September 30, 2019 and no activities were carried oute. GIZ decided to merge the project to another GIZ managed project starting 1 October 2019 and called “Syrian Peace Initiative” (SPI), former “Syrian Peace Process Support Initiative” (SPPSI). A financial contribution by the European Union (through the European External Action Service (EEAS) with the Instrument contributing to Stability and Peace (IcSP) is expected for SPI. The main objective of the original project of supporting the Syrian opposition in UN- led talks in Geneva remains largely unmodified. GIZ is suggesting a new co-financing agreement with the current co-financing partners for the new project. GIZ suggested the Embassy of Sweden in Beirut to transfer remaining funds and or support the new initiative. The Embassy is closing the current project and will continue the dialogue regarding the new proposed initiative. The relation between SPI and the Sida supported project CSSR (Contribution 11448) must be analysed as GIZ provides support to CSSR through Swisspeace in the framework of SPI as well.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
